com.galou.moodtracker.views

Class MoodViewHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
      • com.galou.moodtracker.views.MoodViewHolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.view.View.OnClickListener

    public class MoodViewHolder
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener
    Represent a Mood View Holder

    Display a mood in the Recycler View Setup how a mood is displayed in the RecyclerView. Each mood is displayed with a CardView and the following parameters are setup depending on the mood attributes:

  • the CardView background color
  • the CardView width
  • the comment button if it has a comment
  • display the date in a TextView
    • A RecyclerView.ViewHolder subclass Implements a OnClickListener interface for the views.

See Also:
Mood

      • updateWithMood

        public void updateWithMood(Mood mood,
                           MoodAdapter.Listener callback,
                           android.content.Context context)
        Update ViewHolder with the Mood Data

      • set the background color of the CardView
      • set the size of the CardView
      • set the comment button behavior
      • set the mood date text

Parameters:
mood - Mood display by this item
callback - callback to the fragment
context - context of the RecyclerView
See Also:
Mood, callbackWeakReference, widthScreen, setSizeCardViewForMood(int), setCommentButton(String, MoodAdapter.Listener), setDateText(Calendar, Context)

  • setDateText

    private java.lang.String setDateText(java.util.Calendar date,
                                     android.content.Context context)
    Set the Date text

    Calculate the number of days elapsed since the date of the mood and set the text accordingly Display number in words

    Parameters:
    date - date of the mood
    context - context of the Recycler view, used to get the Resources
    Returns:
    String of the text to display
    See Also:
    Mood, updateWithMood(Mood, MoodAdapter.Listener, Context), NumberToWords, getDayInWeek(long), getCalInMilli(Calendar)
